direction.raw_text: - MOVING SHOT - EARLY WINTER DAY They are riding down a slight grade beyond which (we can assume) is the Comanche camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He breaks and both turn as Look rides over the hill on a little spotted Indian pony, with her squaw-bag slung up behind her and her blanket over the saddle. She closes the gap between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look smiles shyly at Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gestures for her to go back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stares and then dutifully wheels her horse. Martin and Ethan face front again. Look wheels her horse again and is right with them. Martin stops - exasperated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look just sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look smiles and sets her horse in motion as Ethan moves ahead. Martin's face is a mask of comic despair as he gives up. He is mouthing the words -- MARTIN Mrs... Pauley? And Ethan suddenly breaks into song; to the tune of "Skip To My Lou:"
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What I heard back there was that a band o' hostile Nawyeckas came through this way less'n two weeks ago...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excitedly) Think it might be...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's she followin' for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I changed my mind... You can keep your blanket.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go on back...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look... you don't understand... (he waves her away) I don't want it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (explosively)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: don't understand, ya chunkhead! You didn't buy any blanket! Ya bought her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (aghast) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got yourself a wife, sonny!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a wail) Oh no! Tell her she's got to go back...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And have her whole family after our scalps for floutin' one o' their women?... No sir! Come on, Mrs. Pauley...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) I got another gal purtier'n you.  I got another gal purtier'n you.  I got another gal purtier'n you.  Skip to my Lou, my darlin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ethan is wrapped in his blanket roll, head propped by an elbow, grinning sardonically as he watches a strange ritual in the camp. The score is softly reprising "Skip to my Lou."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look is standing with her blanket folded over one arm, her head shyly downcast, not far from where Martin (back to her) is spreading his own bed roll. He sits on it then and begins pulling off his boots. He is very conscious of Ethan's watchful scrutiny. Finally he is ready. He lies back on his blanket. At once Look is at his side to spread her own blanket. Martin sits bolt upright and tugs his blanket free and wraps it protectively around him. She stares at him, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods her understanding, hurries off to fetch a canteen. Martin glares at Ethan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look returns with the canteen, hands it to Martin and kneels beside him. He looks at her sympathetically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now Look speaks for the first time. She indicates herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now she jabbers in Comanche and, at the appropriate time, will point to the sky and imitate a bird flying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin looks blank, but Ethan chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods and smiles and quickly settles alongside him and spreads her blanket over them both. Martin recoils, plants his foot in the small of her back and sends her sprawling. Ethan busts a gut laughing. Martin jumps to his feet, angrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan stares at the girl. Her face is suddenly impassive as she looks from Martin to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets to his feet and he crosses to stand before her. So does Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stares sullenly, not answering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stands... She indicates Martin. She indicates herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks gravely from Ethan to Martin. Then, with impassive face, she bends swiftly, picks up her blanket and walks away from them to choose her own sleeping place. The two men don't know what to make of it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Water!... (in Comanche) Pah!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the way to train 'em. Looks like Mrs. Pauley's goin' to make you a fine beautiful wife...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cut it out, will ya...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look... I wish I could explain to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nay tzare T'sala-ta-komal-ta-name... unt kang-yah Look. (which means) (My father calls me Wild Goose Flying in the Night Sky... but you call me 'Look').
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Says her name's Wild Goose Flying in the Night Sky... but she'll answer to Look since it pleases ya...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (blankly) Look?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hotly) I don't think it's so funny... If you want to do some good, whyn't you ask her where Scar is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grimly) She heard ya-all right... An' she knows...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Unt osupanet cah-nay Scar? (meaning) (You know where Scar is?)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You ask her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look! (she faces him) Scar?... (sign talk) Do you know where he went? And if he has a girl with him... a white girl -- nai-bist pabo taibo...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mah nee-koo-ur? (meaning) (Your woman?)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking head) No... not my wife... My... (to Ethan) How do you say sister?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in Comanche) Nami.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is the same scene the following morning. The men are standing above where Look had bedded for the night, looking at the ground. Clearly marked on the hard ground is a crudely drawn arrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks toward their horses, starts to saddle up. Martin follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Ethan starts singing "Skip to My Lou" half under his breath. Martin gives him a sour side-glance and continues saddling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Beats me how she could get that pony out o' camp without neither of us hearin' a thing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She ain't goin' back to her family, that's certain... not if she took off where the arrow points.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Think she means for us to follow?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How should I know... She's YOUR wife!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think maybe we oughta...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hiding a grin) Yeah, I kinda figgered you'd say that... Bein' a new husband and all...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . JORGENSEN HOME - GROUP AS BEFORE - LAURIE READING - DAY Mrs. Jorgensen is bringing a lighted lamp over to the table where Laurie is reading against the fading light of day. Jorgensen's pipe has gone out and he lights it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe she left other signs for us to follow but we'll never know -- 'cause it snowed all day and all the next week... We were heading north, through the buffalo country when something happened that I ain't got straight in my own mind yet... (her voice fades)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SNOW COUNTRY - WIDE ANGLE SHOT - TWO RIDERS (COLORADO FOOTAGE) The two men are picking their way through a snow-mantled grove. Martin's voice resumes the narration.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ethan's always been throwing it up to me that I'm a quarter-breed... I never figgered it made much difference...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BUFFALO HERD - WIDE ANGLE SHOT - DAY (COLO. FOOTAGE)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But this day we came on a small herd. We needed some meat so we circled 'round...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE HERD - ANOTHER ANGLE (COLO. FOOTAGE)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...and came up on 'em afoot...  They hadn't been hunted, so it was no trick workin' in close.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE HERD - MARTIN AND ETHAN - DAY (COLO. FOOTAGE) The two men walk from behind CAMERA. Ethan aims, fires and brings down a bull.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ethan got a nice one on his first shot, but then he began killing one after another -- cows as well as bulls -- fast as he could fire and load... It was just a slaughter... no sense to it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE HERD BEGINNING TO RUN (COLO. FOOTAGE) Shots cracking out -- the terrified bawling of the bulls -- the beginning of the stampede.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MED. CLOSE SHOT - ETHAN AND MARTIN (PROCESS) Martin strides across to where Ethan is firing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan turns and swings a backhand blow which catches Martin by surprise and fells him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He swings up his gun and fires again -- and again... as Martin stares at him from the ground.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ethan, quit it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (firing again) Nine... (another shot) Ten!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the sense in it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in a fury) Hunger! -- Empty bellies! That's the sense in it, you Cherokee!...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE HERD - LONG SHOT - THE STAMPEDE (COLO. FOOTAGE) Fear-maddened animals are swinging into full stampede fleeing the deadly marksman. Rifle shots keep cracking out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MED. CLOSE SHOT - ETHAN AND MARTIN AS BEFORE (PROCESS) The thunder of the hooves is receding and Ethan grimly lowers his rifle. Martin picks himself up -- still staring at Ethan as though at a madman. Ethan turns and looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He whips out his shinning knife and strides toward the dead buffalo o.s. Martin looks after him with troubled expression. Suddenly he hears something, borne faint by the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan turns. Now faintly, little more than a shred of sound, is the distant blowing of a bugle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan stares -- and then the bugle sound repeats and the distant crack of shots, from long miles off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the two break and run for their horses.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Least, THEY won't feed any Comanches this winter... Killin' buffalo's as good as killin' Injuns in this country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Peaceful tribes depend on the buffalo, too....
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ain't that too bad... If you feel that sorry for your kinfolk, I'm surprised you didn't take up with that squaw wife of yours...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen!... Hear it?... There! Ain't that a bugle... and firing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grimly) Just hope we ain't too late...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . A RIVER - WIDE ANGLE - CAVALRY CROSSING WITH PRISONERS - DAY MARTIN'S VOICE (as narrator) It was all over long before we got there and the soldiers was high- tailin' it back to the agency with their prisoners -- squaws mostly -- by the time Ethan and me reached the camp...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Horses and riders plunge downslope through breast-high snow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It was the Nawyecky Comanches all right -- the ones we'd been looking for all this time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as they ride in, passing dead horses, a few bodies of men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan has dismounted in front of one of the tepees, heads inside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Trouble of it was that the soldiers had hit when most of the fightin' men was away -- huntin' maybe... So most of the dead was old men and women an' kids... And it was in one of the tepees Ethan found her -- the little squaw who wanted me to call her Look...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Ethan enters. A body -- Look's -- is sprawled on the ground. He crosses, turns her over. Martin enters behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sees something clutched in her hand. He stoops quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan, who has turned indifferently to leave, pauses. Martin shows him what Look had been clutching -- Debbie's rag doll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan snatches it, stares at it. Then he turns and runs from the tepee. Martin stares at Look's body, then covers it with a robe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and then slowly heads out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you're a widower now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily) What'd the soldiers have to kill her for!...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ethan!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look! It's hers, Debbie's...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So we knew Debbie had been in the village... What Look was doing there -- whether she'd come to warn them, or maybe to find Debbie for me... there's no way of knowing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ethan stands there, his expression bleak, looking at the scene. Martin joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan isn't thinking of that at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They start away -- fast.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We gotta catch up with them yellow legs... Maybe they got her with them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (harshly) And maybe they got Scar!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A long line stretching across the landscape -- women falling and being prodded along by their captors. From behind CAMERA ride Ethan and Martin and move to intercept the column.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Ethan and Martin come closer and look at the shawled prisoners stumbling along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as a young OFFICER spurs out of the column and rides toward them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The officer spurs out to rejoin the column. Martin looks at Ethan, his face alive with hope. But Ethan is just looking stonily along the line of passing prisoners.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (inquiringly) Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're looking for a girl -- a white girl...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She'd be about thirteen now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got two around that age...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eagerly) Where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll have to wait until we reach the agency... Fall in behind the column...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (protestingly) But couldn't you...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry... (shouting it) Keep the column moving!... Close ranks there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The column of cavalry and prisoners enters the agency (COLORADO FOOTAGE). We see the dead and wounded on travois; the agency Indians watching stoically; the prisoners -- some of them -- being herded into a chapel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The office has been set up as a temporary army headquarters. The GENERAL is being interviewed by two Eastern newspaper CORRESPONDENTS. At a table beyond is a telegrapher, sending out a report of the victory. A pot-bellied stove supplies heat and the General is warming his hands at it, intermittently. An adjutant is rather wearily filling out a long official form. The General, for all his mudded boots remains a beau sabreur and is loosely modeled upon a certain other well-known glory hunter of the Indian wars. He wears a colonel's straps, but insists upon his brevet rank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan and Martin enter, stand in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan ignores him, still facing the General.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keefer coughs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And it was clear to me the hostiles outnumbered us four to one... with all the advantage of terrain...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Four to one! What did you do, general?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impressively) Sir -- we charged!... Gentlemen -- and I hope you will quote me -- I cannot say too much for the courage of the men who followed me into that Cheyenne camp...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (blurting it) Cheyenne! What Cheyenne?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning and staring) I beg your pardon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That camp you hit was Nawyecka Comanche... Chief Scar's bunch...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fascinated) Scar? What a wonderful name!...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to his aide) Are you getting this, Keefer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Ethan) How do you spell that word -- Nawyecka?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My name's Edwards... I'm looking for my niece... she was in that camp when you attacked...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (uncertain) Well... I know there were some captives recovered...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bitterly) Four of 'em dead... so we were told...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (uncomfortably) Unfortunately, the hostiles murdered them as we developed the village...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you sure they didn't die of carbine shots fired by a bunch o' Yank bluebellies so scared they couldn't tell the difference between a Cheyenne and a Comanche?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keefer!... Put this man under arrest!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That'll be the day... (scornfully) 'As we developed the village'... Next time you develop a village, hit it where the fightin' men are... You won't get any headlines for killin' squaws.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shall I show him the captives, sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just get him out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes sir... (he crosses to Ethan) This way...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - ANGLING TO DOOR - AFTERNOON The door is opened by a guard and Ethan takes a step into the room -- then stops in manifest shock. Martin is at his heels, eager and expectant. Beyond them stands Keefer, grave and compassionate. There is a keening sound in the room -- almost an animal sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a simple log-sided room with plank benches without backs. Up front is a small box-like pulpit, no altar. Across the front of the room, set up either on benches or on boards over saw-horses are four blanket-covered figures -- at least two being the bodies of children. Squatting on the floor near them is an elderly white woman with hair hanging loosely down her back and clad in Indian robes. Standing, facing the newcomers, is a woman who may be no more than in her mid-thirties. She is mad -- wild-eyed, frightened, with matted, unbrushed golden hair, torn garments. It is she who has been making the keening sound, the animal moans. Now she crouches at the sight of them and looks desperately for a means of escape. Two girls are asleep, heads together and backs to the door. One has light hair, like Debbie's; the other brown hair. The afternoon sun coming through a high window touches the light hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has seen the light hair and starts crossing the room. Now the madwoman begins her screaming, running from side to side like a trapped animal. Ethan follows Martin into the room, Keefer behind him. Martin comes to a stop, realizing the woman is afraid of him. The two sleeping girls stir, but do not turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The madwoman crouches behind one of the benches, looking at them with frightened eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin swallows and nods and crosses to the light-haired girl. He reaches a hand gingerly to touch her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the touch, the girl is on her feet, crouching -- one hand, like a claw, drawn back to rake his face. She is unmistakably a white girl, but she is painted like a Comanche woman --her ears red inside, streaks of paint accenting the savagery of her face. Her eyes are frightened, yet full of hate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin stares at him, then realizes what he has in mind. He fishes the rag doll from under his coat and holds it out to the girl. She looks at it... and we may almost suspect it is rekindling a memory -- but then she spits at it. The other girl laughs. Martin turns away and he's sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin nerves himself for the ordeal, turns to follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan and Keefer move away. As they do, the madwoman -- eyes fixed on the rag doll in Martin's hand -- begins creeping up behind him. Martin is torturedly watching Ethan and Keefer as first one blanket then another is raised -- we will never see the dead. During this:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin stiffens, waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin relaxes... and in that instant the madwoman has the doll in her hands. She cradles it and she croons. Martin reaches to take it away. But she calmly sits, cradling the doll, and rocks to and fro, humming a lullaby. He can't take it. Ethan returns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They leave.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Debbie?... DEBBIE?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be scared, ma'am...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just don't pay any attention to her...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Debbie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pabo-taibo! (White man!) The other girl has risen almost in the same instant -- but more out of fear. She is younger, but painted like the other. She moves to stand behind the savage one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly) No... She's not...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ain't sure... Where's that doll?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was your niece about their age?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not far from it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hard to realize they're white, isn't it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grimly) They're not white any more -- they're Comanche!... Let's see the bodies...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't need you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (the dispassionate pro) I'd like you to see them all... It might help us identify them... Shot in the head -- flash-burn range... The boy got his skull cracked... Here's the girl...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we only got the one lead -- Scar... And where we begin to look, I don't know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's one thing. We recovered a bushel of trinkets in that camp... cheap stuff... trade goods... Couldn't help noticing that most of it was Mexican... Maybe if you could talk to some of those Mexican traders along the border... What do they call themselves?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Comancheros...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the breed... Course it might take time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Time's running out... But I'm obliged to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Laurie has reached the last page of the letter, reading it by the lamp on the table. Jorgensen is knocking out the dead ashes of his pipe.  Charlie is in the shadows, a guitar in his hands -- not playing it, but occasionally softly picking a note or chord. Mrs. Jorgensen is dabbing moist eyes with a corner of her apron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She swallows hard, pauses a moment in her reading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks almost too obviously at Charlie, which annoys Laurie. Laurie resumes her letter reading:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all there is. Not a cross on it. Laurie just looks at it. Jorgensen stands, pocketing his pipe, easing the crick in his back. He ceremoniously removes the spectacles and replaces them on the mantel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She heads for the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie hits the guitar a little stronger. Mrs. Jorgensen looks at him -- and the matchmaker is at work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Jorgensen smiles and moves about her duties. Laurie has opened the door and is staring out wistfully... and Charlie begins playing and singing a verse from "Skip to My Lou."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DESERT COUNTRY - WIDE ANGLE - ETHAN AND MARTIN RIDING - DAY The search theme is heard again as the two riders, with single pack horse, are heading south through New Mexico. It is hot country.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...so we're setting out for New Mexico Territory in the morning... I am sorry I won't be back for Christmas again this year...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN (quick sympathy) And you knittin' that muffler...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatiently) What's the difference!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN Well, I just thought it would be a sin and a shame not to let SOMEONE get some good of it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (peering closely) There's a word crossed out... It looks like 'I wish' or 'I will'... (she gives up) Anyway... 'I set pen aside in the hope you are enjoying good health and your folks the same... I remain, respectfully... (forlornly) yours truly, Martin Paulie.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They never find that girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (half to herself) Yours truly... (hotly) And he even has to write his full name... Martin Pauley... not even just Martie!... (she stands) I don't care if he never comes back!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN (rising -- saying it without conviction) Now, Laurie!...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN Charlie, you'll stay for supper?... Now I won't take no for an answer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thought of saying 'no' never crossed my mind, Miz Jorgensen... No place I'd rather be than right here, right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) One old boot and a button shoe One old boot and a button shoe...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MOVING SHOT - ETHAN AND MARTIN - DAY Their faces are sun-tanned, burned dark and dry. Gone are the heavy coats and clothing of their northern days. They do not speak, just ride -- and there is the same bleak, fanatic, hard look about them both. The music theme segues into something livelier and Mexican as we -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a small place -- a single dirt street, a few adobe houses; a few racks of dried meat; a burro with a load of faggots on its back being driven along by a small boy; the music coming from a little cantina in the middle of the street. Before the cantina is a bone rack of a horse, without a saddle -- only a blanket pad. There is something familiar about the horse and Ethan is staring at it as they ride in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men dismount, beating dust out of their clothes. Ethan takes another look at the sorry old nag tied outside. Martin pauses beside Ethan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin shakes his head. They start toward the cantina.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Recognize it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There couldn't be two like that in all the world...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Ethan and Martin enter. It is a dirt-floored room with a small bar near the door, chairs and benches along the walls. A pair of guitar players are at the far end of the room. A couple of Mexicans are playing a noisy game of dominoes, slapping the dominoes down hard... EMILIO FIGUEROA, back to the door, spurred boots across one of the tables, is sipping a drink. Emilio is a cynical, middle-aged, aristocratic- looking man in modified charro costume. Watching the domino game is ESTRELLA, lithe, sensuous, smoking a brown-paper cigarette; she is barefoot. Behind the bar is the proprietor, dozing on his stool. Ethan takes a step into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The proprietor awakens. The domino game is suspended in mid- play. Estrella turns... and from beside Emilio, previously obscured by the man's back and the big charro hat, pokes the head of old Mose. Emilio turns then to look at the newcomers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is on his feet and advancing to meet them. As he recognizes them a wide, foolish grin splits his face and his mouth opens and closes in words that won't come out. He grabs and shakes Ethan's arm, then Martin's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin puts his back to the bar, leans elbows on it and looks around.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (loudly)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: !.... MOSE HARPER?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ay-eh...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leggo my arm... You look mangier 'n ever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ain't been too good... No sir, not too good... Gettin' old, Ethan...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were born old...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (all smiles - as they head for the bar) Bienvenidos, senores... Pulque?... tequila?... mescal?... huiskey?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tequila...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lo mismo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beaming)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: par' el Viejo -- el vino del pais... tequila tambien!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE CANTINA - ANGLING PAST MARTIN TOWARD ESTRELLA She is giving him an appraising once-over, then signals the musicians to play. She rests her buttocks against a table and waits, her eyes challenging Martin to make a move. Emilio is watching Estrella and Martin with something akin to bored amusement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE CANTINA - ANGLE AT BAR Ethan has poured a drink for Mose, now one for himself -- leaving Martin's glass empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin turns back to the bar to take his glass. He finds it empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He angrily throws a coin on the counter, appropriates the bottle and his glass and heads for a table closer to Estrella. Neither Ethan nor Mose seems aware of his going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan stares at him. Mose nods his reaffirmation of it. Then Ethan's hand locks on the old man's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mose winces under the grip. He can't speak, but he looks past Ethan and he points. Ethan turns. Emilio swings his boots off the table and slowly crosses to them. He lets cigarette smoke curl out of his mouth. Then he smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the men study each other, Estrella begins her dance -- and the rhythmic click of the castanets will beat like a metronome. Emilio looks at the bottle on the bar, disdainfully pushes it away and imperiously signals the proprietor to bring something better.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I been helpin' ye, Ethan... I been lookin' all the time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Ethan's back) Thanks for nothin'...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, the reward still stands...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't want no money, Ethan... jus' a place -- a roof over m' head... a little grub... a bunk to sleep in... an' a rockin' chair by the fire... my own rockin' chair by a fire...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You help me find her, you got your rockin' chair...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Swear it, Ethan?... Given word?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatiently) Told ya, didn't I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impressively) Ethan... I found a man's seen her... knows where little Debbie is!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who? Where is he... this man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am this man, senor... Emilio Gabriel Fernandez y Figueroa... at your service... (afterthought) ...for a price... (he smiles) ...Always for a price...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Un otra!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He is knocking off his tequila and looking at the girl hungrily. She is doing her swaying dance, playing up to him and with unmistakable effect. He sloshes another drink into his glass and, never taking his eyes off her, downs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE DANCE Beyond Estrella we see Ethan, Emilio, and Mose at the bar -- gestures, headshakes, the entire pantomime of an inaudible conversation. Then Ethan takes out his pouch and begins dropping gold pieces into Emilio's hand. Meanwhile, dance and dancer are achieving their purpose with Martin. And the tequila is working. He gets to his feet, a little groggily. Estrella's smile deepens and there is a clear invitation in her eyes... Ethan turns then, his deal with Emilio concluded, and he sees what is going on. He starts for Martin's table just as Martin moves out to take the girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin tries to push him away, his eyes still on the girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin breaks free and squares off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Estrella ranges herself alongside of Martin and slips an arm possessively through his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and heads out. Emilio, who has come up behind him, gives Estrella a slight smile and bow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He follows Ethan. Estrella swings her body close to Martin and lets her arms slide around his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin blinks to clear away the fog of tequila and desire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls her arms away and goes lurching after the others. Mose catches his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin continues out and Mose stands there -- his head rockin' as though he already were in his chair.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (tolerantly) Come on, Don Juan... We're on our way...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thickly) Lemme alone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking his arm) You breeds are all alike -- two drinks an'...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take yer hands off'n me... This lady an' me got some things to talk over!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a shrug) Suit yourself... While you're enjoyin' your little conversation, I'll be ridin' out with Senor Fernandez here...  The Comanch' medicine country ain't far... there's one camp with a chief named Cicatriz.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never heard of him...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cicatriz is Mex for Scar... an' he has a white girl in his tepee... Be seein' you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Buena suerte, Estrella... Hasta la vista.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Tu quieres...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a bitter laugh) Sure... sure... Only not this year...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Mind Ethan 'bout my rockin' chair!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . (APPROACH TO THE NEEDLES MONUMENT) - A BROAD CANYON -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small pack train (nine or ten horses, six or seven men) winds through a canyon behind which we can see huge needles of rock: majestic, savage country. At the head of the column ride Ethan, Emilio, and Martin. Behind them come Emilio's cargadores -- lean, hard-bitten wiry little Mexicans. One leads a handsome palomino. The SOUND of the CASTANETS ECHOES in the musical theme.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MOVING - DAY Ethan is looking around with grim interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan and Emilio both look in the direction of his glance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Medicine country, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slight smile) Medicine so strong they believe the feather of an eagle found here can guard a man against bullets...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking ahead) If you got one handy, now's the time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FROM BEHIND RIDERS - DAY They are turning a bend and now, ahead, we see a cordon of Comanches -- all armed, all quiet, all very menacing as they watch the approaching column. Emilio calls a greeting in Comanche. It gets no answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CAMERA PICKS UP the faces in turn, as from the white men's viewpoint, as they ride slowly by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One tepee stands apart from the other's -- Scar's. Beyond it are other tepees, the gathering of braves and some squaws, the drying racks for meat, etc. Emilio leads the way toward the central tepee. They dismount nearby and Emilio inclines his head toward the one tepee. Ethan and Martin brace themselves and wait. The flap of the tepee is closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emilio cautions him with a hand gesture.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (gruffly) What are we waiting for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - DAY The flap is thrust aside and SCAR steps out -- the same Comanche we had seen at the grave when Debbie was captured. He stands tall, arrogant, eyeing the white men with hard, implacable eyes. He has a robe gathered about him. Across his face is a scar.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Senores! This is Cicatriz!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The white men's eyes are as hard as the Comanche's: this is the man they have long sought, the killer, the raper. They cannot mask the hatred they feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scar's hand moves to the scar on his face, and a finger runs along it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a leading question and Scar knows it. He looks long at Ethan and the suggestion of a smile touches his lips. But he makes no direct answer. He looks instead to Emilio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emilio quickly turns and calls to one of his men. Emilio is worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the Mexicans comes on the trot, leading in the palomino. Emilio makes a gesture -- giving it to Scar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scar looks at it greedily, then nods. He'll accept it. He looks at Ethan. Again that faintly contemptuous smile. He signals them to enter his tepee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He follows Ethan into the tepee... and a worried Emilio goes along.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly... at last) Scar... It's plain to see where you got your name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your name - Big Shoulders... His name - He Who Follows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You speak pretty good American for a Comanche... Someone teach you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in Comanche) Ah-we pabbo-tie-bo ee-kee-tay? (Why did you bring the gringos here?)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a shrug -- in Comanche) Pabbo-tie-bo kim te-moo-er. (The gringos want to trade.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right... We come to trade... Only not out here... (with sign language accompaniment) I don't stand talkin' in the wind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) Miguel... caballo -- aca!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Co-bay tabitz-chat. (meaning) (Very fine horse.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Martin) Stay out here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not likely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A small fire burns in the center of the lodge and a shaft of sunlight strikes in from the smoke flap at the peak. Two chunky squaws, who have been tending the fire or grinding corn in a rock pestle, scuttle to a side of the tepee. Two others, one half-grown and the other slightly taller, sit with their backs to the fire, huddled over some leather work or stitching. Both are shawled. As Scar enters, he barks a word to the squaws near the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sits on some robes, signs for them to sit opposite. Slowly they look around them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Pie-kay! (Clear out!) (then he turns to the white men)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! (Sit!)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They are sitting with heads averted, slightly profiled -- but clearly Indian women, broad-faced, dark of hair and skin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: His sons are dead... So his wives sit on the honor side of his lodge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (glancing at them) Are those his wives too? One of the squaws turns -- and even in the shadows we see it is another Indian face. The other does not turn. Scar leans in, blocking the view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The slightly smaller of the young squaws stiffens but doesn't move. Scar glares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl gets to her feet. Ethan and Martin watch as, still with averted face, she crosses to where a lance hangs from the tepee wall. It has several scalps on it, including one with light red hair. Slowly she carries it back. Scar never takes his eyes from the faces of the white men, savoring every moment of it. The girl extends the lance between them, so that it is like a bare blade separating two duelists. Neither Ethan nor Martin dares at first look at more than the scalp pole... Then slowly their eyes lift... and the CAMERA MOVES IN and RAISES TO:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: ANGLING PAST ETHAN TOWARD THE TWO YOUNG ONES ETHAN

dialogue.raw_text: Two sons -- killed by white men... For each son, I take many scalps... (in Comanche) Mayah-kay zee-eh!... (Bring the lance!)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (louder)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As the shawl slips back to reveal her light hair, the slant green eyes looking at them from a tanned, but still white and very beautiful face. (NOTE TO MUSIC: The SEARCH THEME should cover all the foregoing action -- but at the first clear view of DEBBIE, it ends dramatically.) Debbie's eyes hold theirs -- and then Scar's voice is heard:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swiftly she straightens, takes away the scalp pole and goes back to her former place.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in Comanche) Pie-kay! (Go!)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - THE GROUP AS BEFORE Scar is watching the white men like a hawk. Martin's eyes are wide and his breathing seems suspended. But Ethan is playing it like a poker player.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scar's eyes are mocking. He lets his robe slip back from his shoulders, revealing a bare bronzed chest on which -- glinting in the reflected firelight -- is the medallion that Ethan had given Debbie. It is suspended by a chain or rawhide string. Scar touches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan smiles -- and he's still playing poker. He stands... and the others follow. Scar is puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scar hasn't understood all of it. He scowls and looks at Emilio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scar looks at Ethan and at Martin. He smiles slightly, and he nods his agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin and Ethan turn to go. Only then does Debbie look swiftly at them and as swiftly away. Martin can't help but pause, but Ethan prods him toward the tepee flap.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (his voice controlled) I've seen scalps before...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This before?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Emilio) I came to trade, not to admire his collection... Tell him we're going to pitch camp across the crick... Maybe we can talk trade tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in Comanche) Ee-sap! Pabbo-tie-bo ee-sap! (He lies! The gringo lies!)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (placatingly) Tomorrow -- manana -- 'puetze.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Puetze!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - MOVING - THE THREE MEN They emerge from the tepee and begin to walk away -- not fast, not slow, and without a side glance. Scar emerges and looks after them -- glowering. A few other Comanches begin to gather near his tepee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They reach the waiting cargadores and the pack train, surrounded by suspicious Comanches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They mount and ride out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (urgently) Walk with dignity! (after a moment; lips hardly moving) If you gringo heretics have any prayers, say them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (transfigured) She's alive... Can you believe it, she's alive... alive... An' we found her...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fervently) Please!... I, too, am alive... I wish to stay that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to his men) Vamanos!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Emilio is standing near his horse, talking to Ethan and Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emilio nods and mounts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He fumbles for a pouch, holds it out to Ethan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He digs spurs and rides out. Ethan turns and looks soberly at Martin. We hear the rest of the riders moving away. Ethan and Martin cross the sand and go down slope toward the creek where their horses are waiting.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You understand, senores... It is not that I am cobarde... cowardly...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't apologize... You did your job...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He knows you -- who you are -- and why you are here... This I did not understand... or I would not... even for gold, senores... have led you here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take it. I do not want blood money. Vaya con Dios!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SAND CREEK (MONUMENT) - FULL SHOT - THE TWO - DAY MARTIN You figger Scar means to kill us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He breaks and both wheel as sand slides from the top of the dunes. They look up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He's got to... All these years, runnin', dodgin', knowin' we were after him... Now we caught up... It's him or us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't he make his move back there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know... Somethin' tied his hands... maybe hospitality...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SAND DUNE - DAY Debbie is silhouetted atop the dune, looking down at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She slides down the dune to stand across the creek from them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (barely breathing the name) Debbie...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SAND CREEK - FULL SHOT - THE THREE - DAY Her hand cautions them to silence and against coming any closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hesitates. She looks long at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These have been her first words in English... and they bring new hope to Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin turns as Ethan slowly reaches for his gun. It takes Martin a moment to realize what he is about to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves quickly then to put himself between Ethan and the girl and in that instant there is the crack of a rifle. Ethan is hit in the leg. It goes out from under him. Martin swings and his gun is out and firing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in Comanche) Unnt-meah! (Go away!) Both men move closer. She takes a frightened step back, as if to run.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Debbie... Don't you remember me? I'm Martin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in Comanche) Unnt-meah!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) We ain't goin'! We ain't goin' without you, Debbie... Ethan, get the horses... I'll try to keep her talkin'...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (harshly) How? She's even forgot her own language!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Debbie, you're comin' with us!  Hear me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... not now... not ever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't care what they've done to you... what happened...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily) They have done... nothing... They are my people...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your people? They murdered your family!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reverting to Comanche) Ee-sap! (furiously) White men killed them - to steal cows! I was... little... I ran away... They find me... take care of me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No Debbie! That ain't what happened! They been lyin' to you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lie! All white men lie... and kill...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Debbie, think back! I'm Martin... remember? Remember how I used to let you ride my horse? Tell you stories? Don't you remember me, Debbie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I remember... from always... At first I prayed to you... come and get me... take me home... You didn't come...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've come now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These are my people... (in Comanche) Unnt-meah! Go! Go! Please!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grimly) Stand aside, boy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ethan -- NO!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SAND CREEK - FULL SHOT - INCLUDING THE DUNES - DAY A mounted Comanche is on the crest of the dune above them -- rifle raised. Martin's first shot brings him down the dune in a spectacular horse-and-man fall. Debbie goes running like a deer up the creek, away from Martin; in the same instant we hear the angry yells of distant Comanches charging from the far left. Martin turns to see Debbie running away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan is on his feet now and limping frantically toward their horses. He shoves Martin ahead of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They mount and take off, just as the vanguard of the attacking Comanches swings around a point of rock and comes charging toward the creek.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Debbie! WAIT!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily) Never mind her! MOVE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Ethan and Martin race their horses from the creek area and down a long incline, as -- from the heights above -- a dozen or more Comanches, led by Scar, come tearing after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DESERT COUNTRY - MED. CLOSE SHOT - ETHAN - MOVING - DAY Ethan is swaying in his saddle, just barely hanging on, as Martin races up behind him -- driving Ethan's horse along. They swing past a huge outcrop of rock and go tearing along a vaulting wall of stone. Their hoofbeats and those of the pursuers bounce and echo off the canyon walls, and bullets whine and ricochet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CANYON COUNTRY - FULL MOVING SHOT - ETHAN AND MARTIN - DAY They swing around giant boulders, up-ended like pancakes. Ethan is lurching almost out of the saddle, barely conscious. Martin spots the cave -- ahead -- and drives his mount and Ethan's toward it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE CAVE (MONUMENT) - FULL SHOT - THE TWO - DAY Martin pulls his horse in and swings off just as Ethan slides from his saddle. He runs toward one of the huge boulders, crouches and starts firing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CANYON COUNTRY - WIDE ANGLE ON THE COMANCHES - DAY The Comanches are spread out but coming on fast. One goes down under Martin's fire.... another is hit in the arm. He pulls up and the other Comanches wheel away from the hidden marksman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE CAVE - FULL SHOT - MARTIN AND ETHAN Martin runs back from his firing post toward where Ethan has fallen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan turns and sees what he means. He starts dragging himself to the cave as Martin grabs the rifles from their saddle scabbards, yanks off the water canteens and then drives their horses away. Then he too runs for the shelter of the cave.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily) Go on! Get out of here while you can...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing to the cave) Over there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE CANYON - ANGLING FROM BEHIND MARTIN AND ETHAN Both men are crouching, rifles ready. In the distance we see their horses running off -- pursued by some yelling Comanches. Four or six others come into sight, heading for the cave -- moving cautiously, uncertainly -- not seeing their quarry. Then the white men open fire and the Comanches bend low over their horses' necks and clear out of there. Ethan looks grimly at Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets an arm under Ethan and hauls him to his feet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They'll be back...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We won't be here... Come on!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE GAP IN THE CLIFF - PANNING SHOT - SUNSET CAMERA PANS from the top of the rock chimney to where Martin is snaking his way through, carrying newly-filled water canteens. He stands there, listening and looking back the way he has come; and then, satisfied there has been no pursuit, he continues away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE CAVE - MED. SHOT - ETHAN - HALF-LIGHT Ethan is lying on the hard earth, perhaps cushioned with some boughs. He is half delirious. A small fire is burning. Martin enters carrying the canteens. He looks unsympathetically toward Ethan, then continues to the fire, takes a knife and starts to sterilize it. Ethan gasps, mumbles and then a word comes clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin stares at him -- and now, perhaps for the first time, he is fitting pieces into the jig-saw puzzle. He shifts closer to Ethan and we see he is preparing to dig out the bullet. Ethan opens his eyes and looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He poises the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He fumbles in his shirt pocket, brings out a greasy folded piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin sets the knife down, takes the paper, opens it and slowly reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin shoves him back onto the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets to his feet, trembling, and stands looking down at Ethan, his fists clenched at his sides and murder in his eyes. Then his eyes rove to the knife lying on the blanket. He picks it up and he looks again at the wounded man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he kneels again to open the wound.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Martha... Martha!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I gotta open that leg and let the poison out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just in case... Read it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ethan Edwards, being of sound mind and without any blood kin, do hereby bequeath all my property of any kind to Martin Pauley...' (he stares, then) I don't want your property.... 'Sides, what do you mean no 'blood kin?' Debbie's your blood kin...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not no more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily) You can keep your will! (he thrusts it back into Ethan's shirt) I ain't forgettin' you was all set to shoot her yourself... What kind o' man are you, anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sitting up -- eyes blazing) She's been with the bucks! She's nothin' now but a...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a shout) Shut your dirty mouth!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly) I hope you die!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Martin is hauling an improvised travois over the ground in which, lashed by vines and some clothing, is the unconscious figure of Ethan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MARTIN - DAY Eyes shadowed, whiskered, drawn -- he is an implacable figure as he drags the weary miles home. He hears a groan from Ethan o.s. He barely lets his eyes drift to the sound. He doesn't stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ETHAN IN THE TRAVOIS - DAY We see he is delirious, lips parched, strapped to the poles. The travois jolts over the ground. As he passes out of frame, the CAMERA HOLDS on the marks of the travois poles scraping across the desert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JORGENSEN KEEPING ROOM - FULL SHOT - NIGHT A party is in progress. Fiddler and banjo-player are playing a lively square dance for one or two sets of dancers -- ranchers, their wives and daughters. Laurie is not in evidence. At the far end of the room is a table with a punch bowl set up and a cluster of men and women about. Jorgensen is at the door boisterously welcoming some new arrivals. Leading them into the room is Captain the Reverend Sam Clayton, with a bulky oil-skin package under his arm. With him is Charlie MacCorry, dressed in his best black suit and scrubbed until he looks raw. Behind them come three or four other competent-looking men -- Rangers all of them.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FADE OUT OMITTED FADE IN INT

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting) They're here, mama... Come in, come in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . JORGENSEN HOME - FULL SHOT - FAVORING GROUP AT DOOR Clayton waits for Charlie to come abreast, then hits him on the back and drives him inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Jorgensen hurries over, beaming, to admire Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Jorgensen smiles and playfully pushes him toward the guests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clayton -- and the other Rangers -- have been hanging gunbelts on pegs along the wall. Now he shakes out his parcel -- disclosing a green-black frock coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Jorgensen glares as he heads out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here he is, Lars... Combed, curried 'n washed behind the ears!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN Why, Charlie, you look real handsome!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grinning) Yes'm... scarcely reck'nize myself... Where's Laurie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN You'll see her soon enough...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding to the music) Say, that music sounds so good it must be sinful...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN Grab a partner, reverend!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, now, a man of my age just can't haul off and dance in cold blood... but if there's any of that wild cherry brandy of yours, Lars...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (suddenly sober) Nooo... (change of heart) Yah, by golly... One jug left... I get it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN Last winter that man swore up and down there wasn't a drop left -- and me with pneumoney!... Reverend, you'd better start clergyin' again!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . JORGENSEN HOME - FULL SHOT - NIGHT Horses, wagons fill the yard. We can hear the lively music of the square dance. As Jorgensen opens the door and sets out toward the barn, a battered dusty trap drives in -- and on it are Martin and Ethan. Jorgensen at first doesn't recognize them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then he sees who they are, and his jaw drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says it as though that explains everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin throws the reins aside and jumps out. Jorgensen grabs his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin tries to break free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heads around the side. Ethan meanwhile has climbed stiffly down, slightly favoring his leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He brushes past the little man and heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (hailing them) Hi!... You're late... hurry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring) Ethan... Martie... No, don't get down! ...You can't come in!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Rangers are here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that got to do with us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyeing the house) What's goin' on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (who's forgotten they wouldn't know) Why, my Laurie's getting married...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait! Don't you hear me! The Rangers...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You been posted for murder... both of you... That trader fella, the late Mister Futterman...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I gotta see Laurie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (desperately) Go around the side... the grandmother's room... I'll tell her... PLEASE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You better!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quick... hide in the barn, Ethan...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hide? Why would I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ETHAN as he enters, with Jorgensen at his heels. For a moment, as he stands there, the party breezes on. Then first one, then another sees him. They gape, and the music falters and stops. Sam Clayton crosses to confront him across the width of the room. Jorgensen tries to be the easy, smiling host--and makes a very bad job of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't even finish it but stands there making flapping gestures.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Look everybody... Look who's...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: others gaping. During the opening lines, Jorgensen will covertly back toward the door to the inner room -- Laurie's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His face contorts and his smile is twisted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Jorgensen throws herself against his chest, sobbing. Ethan looks past her at Clayton. And the faces of both men are grim.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to all) Evenin'... evenin' Reverend... or do I call you 'Captain'...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Came here for a wedding, Ethan... Until that's over, I reckon 'reverend' will do...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN (coming forward) And news of our little girl, Ethan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's not a little girl any more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN (eyes wide) You've seen her!... She's alive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've seen her... and she's alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The room is dark. Martin is pacing, eyes constantly turning to the inside door. And then it opens and Laurie is inside, holding a lamp. She is in her bridal gown and very obviously trying to keep from betraying the stress she is under.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just stares at her -- very lovely, strangely remote. He suddenly is conscious of his dirty hands, his dusty, worn clothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sinks onto the bench.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She begins to cry, very softly. He is beside her and his arm goes around her shoulder comfortingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they are kissing through her tears when the outer door is flung open by Charlie MacCorry. They part as he glares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin stares at him, then at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin swings wildly but Charlie is a wily fighter. He side- steps and chops Martin in the jaw and drives him against the wall. Laurie runs between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin gently brushes her aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin nods and unbuckles his gunbelt. The men head outside as Laurie runs to get help.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Hello, Martie....
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... I wrote you a letter... Reckon you didn't get it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (setting the lamp down) One letter in five years... I read it till the paper dried up and the writing faded out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It wasn't much of a letter...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it wasn't... You mighta said you loved me... You mighta asked me to wait... At least that'd have been something...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I allus loved you... You know that, without my sayin' it... I couldn't bring myself to ask you to wait... the little I had... not knowin' how much longer until we found Debbie...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (breaking) It isn't fair...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sobbing) It isn't fair, Martin Pauley, and you know it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't cry, Laurie... I understand how it is... I'll just go 'way...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (spinning on him) You do and I'll die, Martie... I will! I'll just die!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll thank you to leave the room, Laurie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (incredulous) Charlie MacCorry!... You weren't fixin' to marry HIM??
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She sure is!... An' don't think your comin' back is goin' to change it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As to that, I don't know, Charlie... We hadn't got around to talkin' marriage...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What right you got to be talkin' marriage to any decent woman...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily) If you're talkin' about that crazy murder charge...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: other things... Mebbe you thought you was gettin' away with being comical about that Indian wife you took... I bet she wasn't the first squaw you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop it! Both of you... I won't have any fighting in this house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all right... Charlie, let's move outside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ain't wearing no gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE JORGENSEN HOME - BREEZEWAY Charlie waits assuredly as Martin follows him outside. Martin makes a wild run, swings. The blow is neatly guarded by Charlie's left and countered with a crisp right that puts Martin down. Martin gets to his feet, more cautiously this time, and comes in at a crouch; he's fighting like an Indian, not a white man. The men from the wedding party come out now at a run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie turns slightly and in that instant Martin springs and drives a straight right at his face -- almost as though there were a knife in the hand. MacCorry stumbles back into Clayton's arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin waits at a crouch as Charlie comes in, feints his right and crosses his left. It is a hard blow but Martin recovers and waits... Charlie circles and starts to repeat. He feints his right but this time Martin springs in, ducks and -- as the left shoots out -- he grabs the wrist and throws Charlie over his head. What we are looking at, in effect, is a wrestler against a boxer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie is on his feet and warily starts circling -- now trying to imitate Martin's crouch. Suddenly Martin feints a right swing and connects with a solid left -- reversing the order of business. Charlie staggers and Martin follows up with a wrestling hold, leaping behind Charlie, locking both legs around him and driving his arms upward behind his back so that his face is in the dirt and so he could -- under other circumstances -- be neatly and expeditiously scalped. With the hands locked, Martin then calmly draws a knife. He looks innocently into the aghast faces of the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With that he releases the paralyzed arms just long enough to grab a lock of Charlie's hair and neatly snip it off. He stands then and laughs as Charlie lamely gets to his feet -- easing the tortured arms. Clayton goes to Charlie's side. Laurie moves to Martin's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie frowns and looks off at where Laurie and Martin are standing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks rather unsteadily away leaving a thunderstruck assembly, murmurous with surprise.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (yelling) Sergeant MacCorry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is this in the line of duty, sergeant?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (regaining his balance) No sir... pleasure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In that case, give the boys room...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fight fair, son... Use your fists!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (drily) Comanches don't use their fists, reverend... Let 'em alone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could scalp him... but I'll just count coup!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You all right, sergeant?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dunno... Seems so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, go get cleaned up and we'll proceed with the weddin'...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ain't goin' to be any weddin' -- not till we get a few things cleared up 'round here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The last of the wedding guests is leaving: Ed Nesby carrying his bull fiddle and with his wife and daughter and two smaller children preceding him out the door. The Jorgensens stand by -- trying to put a good face on the wedding debacle. Charlie MacCorry is sitting dejectedly, studying a spot on the floor. Ethan is at the mantel. Laurie is in her room -- presumably changing out of her wedding gown. Martin is at a sink, bathing a cut on his lip. Clayton, still in his clerical coat, is near the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Jorgensen puts her handkerchief to her eyes -- letting down now that the guests have gone. Jorgensen crosses to her, pats her sympathetically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leads her away. Clayton faces Ethan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan casually reaches into his pocket, takes out a gold coin and spins it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin crosses to confront Clayton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie gets to his feet and he has his gun in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fast hoofbeats sound o.s. -- signalling the approach of a four-man cavalry detail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He and Jorgensen head for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A voice hails from outside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (a grin) Well... it was a nice weddin' party... considerin' no one got married... 'Night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good night, Ed...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, mamma!...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got to ask you and Martin to ride to the State Capitol with me, Ethan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This an invite to a necktie party, Reverend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain... Nope, wouldn't say that... Likely you had your reasons for killin' Futterman... Probably needed killin'... I'm speaking as a ranger now, not as a reverend... Fact that all three was shot in the back is the only thing that's raised some question -- that and a missin' gold piece known to have been on him just prior to his demise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (casually) That so?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ain't goin' to Austin, Reverend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're goin' if the captain says you're goin'...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, now... let's not grow disputatious...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning) What's that? More company?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kinda late getting here, aren't they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello there! Captain Clayton?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . JORGENSEN HOUSE - ANGLE AT DOOR - NIGHT Clayton stands in the opened doorway, Jorgensen behind him, looking out. Drawn up outside is the four-man cavalry detail, led by a young and very crisp LIEUTENANT. We may or may not see the sixth man, slouched over his horse. The Lieutenant swings off and crosses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lieutenant gapes at Clayton's ministerial coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan chuckles, to Clayton's very obvious annoyance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Colonel wishes to know how soon you could put a company of Rangers in the field, fully armed and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then he is striding to the door, calling it:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the old man totters in, half-supported by a trooper -- hollow-eyed, weak, almost delirious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tries to lead him away, but Ethan shoves her aside and grips the old man by his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He staggers and this time Mrs. Jorgensen won't be denied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leads him away, at last to his rocker by the fire. During this, Ethan and Clayton have been mulling Mose's answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam Clayton wheels on the Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lieutenant skedaddles. Sam whirls on Martin and Ethan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leaves. Martin's hands go to his side -- recalling where he left his guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heads for the inner door to the grandmother room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is Captain Clayton here, Reverend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm Clayton.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (doubtfully) You're Captain Clayton?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (recovering, he salutes) Colonel Greenhill's compliments, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold on, son... Who's this Colonel Greenhill you're talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why Colonel Greenhill is Colonel Greenhill, sir... Commanding Officer, Fifth U.S. Cavalry... I'm Lieutenant Greenhill, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh... Now what's this your pa wants to know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My pa wants to know... Colonel Greenhill wants to know how soon you could put a company of your Rangers in the field, fully armed and equipped, for joint punitive action against the Comanches.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: action?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes sir... We've received information about a band of Comanches under a chief named Scar...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What information?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That maybe he's not far from here -- holed up somewhere, waiting his chance to get back over the border... He raided north about a month ago... ran into more army than he bargained for... Now he's running for cover, for keeps this time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what makes you think he's in this territory?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yesterday, one of our patrols picked up a man claims he was a prisoner with Scar till only two days ago... He talks crazy but I brought him along... Says he lives here... keeps mentioning a rocking chair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (half to himself) Mose...
dialogue.name: dialogue
