dialogue.raw_text: Ay-he?... Ay-eh?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come f'r my rockin' chai'... ole Mose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting it) Where's Scar, Mose... SCAR?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ask him about Debbie!... Is she all right, Mose?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My rockin' chai'...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN (bustling over) Leave the poor man be! Can't you see he's out of his mind...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mose... try to remember!... You were in Scar's camp...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ay-he... Made out I was crazy... (he giggles foolishly) Ate dirt... chewed grass... I fooled 'em, Ethan!... an' I got away...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scar! Where's he holed in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seven Fingers... ay-he... Seven...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . JORGENSEN Now that's enough!  Here... by the fire... What you need's a good bowl of soup...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (blankly) Seven Fingers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what he told us... but there's no such place on the maps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute! Isn't that the Caddo name for where all those canyons branch on the Malapai?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (from his rocker) Caddo or Kiowa... ay-he... ay-eh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You tell your pa a company of Rangers -- all fourteen of 'em -- fully armed an' equipped will be in the field by daylight... headin' for the south end of the Malapai. If he can catch up with us, well an' good...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But... but captain, we can't possibly take the field tomorrow... for your own protection...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sonny, yonder's a passel of murderers, complete with Texican scalps an' white girl captive... You want to protect us, you just get out of our way... Now skedaddle!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ethan, you an' Martin are hereby appointed civilian scouts -- without pay... Charlie, hightail it to headquarters an' spread the word...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes sir...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My guns...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Martin enters and crosses to where he had dropped his gunbelt. Even before he reaches it, Laurie is in the room -- closing the door after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He strides out past her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Martie... don't go! Not this time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring) You crazy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's too late... She's a woman grown now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got to fetch her home...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fetch what home?... The leavin's of Comanche bucks -- sold time an' again to the highest bidder?... With savage brats of her own, most like?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting it) Laurie! Shut your mouth!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know what Ethan will do if he has a chance?... He'll put a bullet in her brain! And I tell you Martha would want him to!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only if I'm dead!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Martin re-enters. Ethan and Sam are waiting. Martin looks hard at Ethan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they stride out,
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You ready?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyes never leaving Ethan's face) I'm ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . JORGENSEN HOUSE - GRANDMOTHER ROOM - CLOSE SHOT - LAURIE - NIGHT as she stands at the window, in her bridal gown, and sadly watches Martin again going away. Softly the score reprises -- sadly now -- "Skip to My Lou."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAWN LIGHT A file of eighteen men and horses -- Rangers -- is walking under the shoulder of a mesa, keeping well below the skyline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAWN LIGHT They pass CAMERA one by one -- Sam Clayton in the lead, Martin behind him leading two horses, then the others -- grim- looking, capable men of varying ages; some with long drooping mustaches, some in need of shaves, some chawing tobacco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - AT RIM OF A MESA - DAWN LIGHT He is lying prone, his hat off, squinting down into a long reach of desert canyon at the Comanche encampment -- with tepees set up, a thin wisp of smoke rising from a fire, the horse herd penned in a draw cut off by an improvised corral of rawhide ropes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOT - DAWN LIGHT The camp is sleeping. A dog yaps shrilly. One of the tepee flaps opens and Scar steps out. He picks up a stone or a chunk of wood and throws it. The dog yelps and runs off. Scar's air is troubled, suspicious. He heads for the horse herd. The camp sleeps on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - AT RIM OF A MESA - DAWN LIGHT His face betrays a bitter inner satisfaction. He looks back along the trail as faintly we hear the approach of the Ranger company. Then he squirms back, retrieving his hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAWN LIGHT Sam, seeing Ethan in the near distance, raises his hand in a signal for halt and waits. Ethan scrambles down the trail to join him. He takes the reins of his horse from Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves as though to mount, but Martin steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam stares at him, but Martin isn't surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin stares, quick disbelief in his eyes. But Ethan's eyes hold his and there is no doubting the truth in them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam puts his hand on Martin's elbow -- as though to turn him to his duty. But Martin jerks the arm away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan looks long and hard at Martin, then reaches into his shirt for the folded, dirty, dog-eared paper that was his will. Slowly he tears it into shreds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin squats and starts pulling off his boots. He glances up as Charlie MacCorry comes over, an Indian blanket in his hands. He tosses it onto Martin's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he grins and extends his hand. Martin takes it -- and they shake as Charlie pulls him to his feet. Martin drops his hat, and then -- at a crouching run -- he heads for the distant Comanche camp.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We can get within 500 yards... there's a hogback to the south.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many, would you say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (drily) Enough to go around... I'd say about a dozen apiece... Mount 'em up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait! We go chargin' in, they'll kill her... and you know it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) It's what I'm countin' on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know you are... Only it ain't goin' to be that way... she's alive...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Livin' with Comanches ain't bein' alive...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (same tone) She's alive... Better she's alive and livin' with Comanches than her brains bashed out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now son, it's a bitter thing to say, but there's more than your sister at stake here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There sure is! I'm going to tell you somethin'... I wasn't going to speak of it... But I'll tell you now.  Did you notice them scalps strung on Scar's lance? (MARTIN NODS) Did you see the third scalp from the point of the lance? Long... wavy hair...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw it... And don't try to tell me it was Aunt Martha's or Lucy's...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't remember it, but I remember. That was your mother's scalp!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't want to tell you... but maybe it's your right to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Now mount up, son...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It don't change it... All I'm askin' is a chance to sneak in there... an' try to get her out before you come chargin' in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if you're caught?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It won't tell 'em anything, will it! Just a man alone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I say NO!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go ahead, son... But at the first alarm, we're comin' in -- and we ain't goin' to have time to pick and choose our targets when we do...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's your funeral...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here... you fight like a Comanch... Maybe this'll help ya pass as one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as he runs downslope under the shelter of the hogback toward the unseen camp. Clayton waves an arm at his men and starts leading out -- in a somewhat different direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are leading their horses down the slope, still under the lee of the butte, when two riders are seen approaching at a fast gallop -- Lt. Greenhill and his courier. (The latter is a bugler).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam whips off his hat and makes frantic signals to Greenhill to shut up. Greenhill pulls to a canter, puzzled, and rides in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts away. Greenhill follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He whips out his sabre -- to the imminent peril of Captain Sam who quickly shifts out of the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then Sam continues away and the Rangers after him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What in...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calling -- still distant) Captain Clayton... Captain!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (exploding) Go on! Whyn't you have your bugler sound the charge while you're at it??
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (blankly) Sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never mind... Your pa know you're out here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir... Troop's about ten miles back... The Colonel sent me looking for you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dismissing him) Well you found me... Good work, son... Good work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If there's anything I can do, sir...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (under his breath) God forbid... No, son, you flog on back and tell your pa where we're at... and where he's at...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But he knows THAT, sir... Can't I stay, sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reluctantly) All right... But keep your eye on me, boy... I'm the hard case you're up against here -- not these childish savages... If you don't hear me first time I holler, you better read my mind... I don't aim to raise no two hollers on any subject at hand...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watch that knife, boy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Martin runs from behind CAMERA and dodges behind a rock. The camp is still asleep, very quiet. Martin runs out from behind the rock and makes another short dash toward the camp, dropping behind a pile of blankets or other impedimenta. A dog runs out of one of the tepees, begins barking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - SCAR He stands with another Comanche -- inspecting the horse lines. In the near distance the dog's barking is heard -- shrill, insistent. Scar, almost like an animal, sniffs the air suspiciously. The other Comanche laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scar isn't satisfied but returns to his work.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tahbo. (A rabbit.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: FAVORING SCAR'S TEPEE PAST MARTIN He is staring at it -- remembering it from certain distinct decorations. The lower part of the tepee is rolled up, for better air circulation. Martin wraps Charlie's blanket around him and begins walking to the tepee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The line is drawn up, dismounted, the men checking their sidearms, tightening cinches, etc. Sam moves briskly along the line of men, then mounts his horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last comes as Greenhill tries to mount, simultaneously flailing out his sabre perilously close to Clayton.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: THE LEE OF THE HOGBACK OR RISE

dialogue.raw_text: The State of Texas is payin' you boys $12 a month. Here's your chance to earn it... Now I don't want any foolin' around after scalps. We ain't got the time... Yankee cavalry's on its way here to set those Comanches free... We gotta beat 'em to it -- our way... Now mount an' guide center on young Greenhill here. Son, you just follow me... And WATCH THAT KNIFE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - MARTIN Martin has gained the tepee, takes one quick look around, then strides in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Martin enters. One robe, tossed back, shows where Scar has slept. Against one wall lie the huddled figures of two squaws. Two other figures -- one being Debbie's -- sleep in robes. Martin's eyes go to Scar's place and then rove slowly and hold on:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - DEBBIE She moves slightly so that the light strikes her fair hair. Martin kneels close to her and gently touches her shoulder, to awaken her. Her eyes open, then widen in fear. Martin quickly claps a hand over his mouth. Silently she fights him, trying to pull the hand away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then her fingernails rake his hand. He winces and lets go. She screams and tries to leap up. He grabs her. The other squaws wake -- begin squawking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Debbie sees something beyond him. Her eyes widen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (a hoarse whisper) Debbie... don't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grimly) I'm takin' you whether you want to or not...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a scream)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: , AS FROM HER P.O.V. - SCAR He looms in the flap of the tepee much as he had over the grave when he first kidnapped her. He has a scalping knife in his hand. Scar whips his arm back. Behind him we see the other Comanche -- the one from the horse herd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin spins and his gun is out. He fans the trigger hammer twice -- and both slugs hit Scar. As the other Comanche leaps in, Martin's gun speaks again. And then he is on his feet, catching Debbie by the arm -- unresisting now -- and pulling her after him through the camp. Shouts and cries bespeak the awakening of the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are mounted and in line. The echo of a shot comes bouncing back. Clayton is facing the men. He solemnly doffs his hat and bows his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And shouting the rebel yell, he leads the charge. The yell is picked up by every man and the bugler sounds the charge as though he had a regiment at his back. Lt. Greenhill -- a West Point beau sabreur in strange company -- has his sabre at the "charge."
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: For these Thy gifts which we are about to receive... (donning his hat, he turns to the bugler) Sound that horn, son, and Leave Us Go Amongst Them...YA-HEE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the swamp of men and horses, we just have time to notice that Sam is darting a somewhat worried look at Greenhill's saber ominously close to his back. The charge is sounding, the hooves are drumming and the men are yelling the way they did when they rode with Bedford Forrest -- reins in their teeth, guns in their fists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comanches are running from the tepees, trying to reach their horse herd as the file of Rangers knifes in.  The bark of hand guns is a steady sound now -- and the Comanches have never been up against such marksmen. One charging Ranger rides down a tepee. Another, with two guns drawn, scores a running double on two Indians racing toward him from opposite sides of his fast-running horse. A dodging Comanche screams as a barrel-chested roan hits him broadside and sends him sprawling into the embers of the campfire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He yanks his horse back to its haunches, firing at a Comanche crouched near the tepee. The charge races past him. Ethan swings off and runs to the tepee flap, whips it open and glares. A squaw comes running out at him, knife upraised, but he knocks her sprawling with a full arm sweep. He turns and his face is a mask of frustration -- and then he freezes, seeing what he has been looking for:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .O.V. Martin is running with Debbie, trying to pull her along, while she kicks and claws and tries to break free. (They are about thirty yards from the camp proper.) Riderless horses are milling, circling. O.s. we can hear the firing, the yells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan remounts and heads around the side of Scar's tepee. In the distance we see Martin and Debbie. The Rangers, regrouping, are charging back through the camp, driving the Comanche horse herd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - MARTIN AND DEBBIE Martin hears Ethan's horse riding down at them; he turns, and Debbie pulls free and starts to run away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes running into the path of Ethan's horse.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No, Ethan! NO!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Martin runs and grabs hold of his stirrup, trying to fight the horse to a stop. Ethan swings on him -- once, twice -- and Martin is knocked sprawling. Ethan rides on, relentlessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is running and dodging, trying to escape the horseman. Ethan has his gun drawn. She ducks to one side and the horse goes past. Both figures are almost obscured in the dust. Ethan spins his mount and charges after her. She runs and then falls -- and he is off his horse and striding toward her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan is at the left of CAMERA and slightly closer to the foreground, with Debbie at the right, supine on the ground and the dust swirling around her. Ethan draws and raises his gun. The hammer goes back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dust clears. The CAMERA MOVES slightly forward along the gun arm and HOLDS on Debbie's face -- the eyes gazing fearlessly, innocently into Ethan's. We HOLD for a long moment and then the gun lowers. Ethan slowly holsters it and walks over to her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) I'm sorry, girl... Shut your eyes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He looks down at her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) You sure favor your mother...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - THE TWO He extends his hand to her. She takes it and he helps her to her feet. And then she is against his chest and his arm goes protectingly about her. They are standing that way when Martin stumbles up -- and stares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMANCHE CAMP - WIDE ANGLE - DAY The line of Rangers is afoot now, each man near his horse, each man with rifle out, pumping shot after shot at the fleeting remnant of Comanches riding down the long valley with their scattered horse herd milling and criss-crossing in mid-ground... And then as the firing slackens, from afar we can hear the blare of a cavalry bugle sounding the charge: sign of the approach of Greenhill's troop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is perhaps half an hour later. Clayton is very grim of face and occasionally wincing. His trousers are down over his ankles, his shirt-tails flapping over his long-handled red underwear. Behind him Charlie MacCorry is kneeling, applying some crude first aid to Sam's rump. Beyond them some of the Rangers are readying for the move-out. Sam looks up angrily as COLONEL GREENHILL, a guidon bearer, and bugler ride in. Greenhill is a choleric man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie just gapes, but Clayton -- grim-lipped -- bends a meaningful glare on someone off. Greenhill looks that way.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Clayton, if you were in my command I'd have you courtmartialed for this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily, to MacCorry) Hurry it up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter, sir... You wounded? What is it, Sergeant -- a bullet or an arrow?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . GREENHILL He is standing with his sabre at salute -- looking as miserable as any shavetail would look when in disgrace. It could be that the end of the sabre has a pronounced bend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam suddenly slaps MacCorry's hand away and grabs for his pants and pulls them up -- and around a tepee come three figures -- Ethan, Debbie, and Martin -- with Ethan holding Debbie's hand. And Sam's face is split by a grin as he tucks his shirt-tails in and goes to meet them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is in a rocker on the porch. Suddenly he stares out and stops rocking. Faint in the distance, but coming closer, the clop-clop of two horses, moving at a walk. A moment later Jorgensen emerges and comes to stand beside Mose, shading his eyes and squinting against the sun, still not recognizing the distant horsemen.  He is joined by Mrs. Jorgensen. And then Laurie comes out and she too stares, frowning at first, then with dawning realization. Lars and Mrs. Jorgensen also begin to guess... to suspect... and then to know. And Laurie starts to run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CAMERA MOVES ahead of her as she runs blindly over the hard-packed ground, running as hard as she can toward the still unseen but nearing horsemen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ethan has Debbie on the pommel of his saddle, his arm supporting her, and she is asleep. Martin is riding beside them. Laurie comes running up to stare at Ethan and at the girl. He smiles and puts a finger to his lips -- cautioning her against waking Debbie -- and then he rides by. Laurie looks then at Martin. He doesn't know whether to smile or not; he just waits. And then she is beside him and she steps onto his stirruped foot and vaults up beside him, and she kisses him just as she had on the day he left the graves to take up the search. And still holding her beside him, he rides slowly after Ethan and Debbie toward the house.
direction.name: direction
